title: Man With No Arms Can Shoot Bow

content.en: Can you shoot a bow? It's easy. Put the arrow on the string of the bow. Pull the string. Where do you want the arrow to go? That's your target. Point at your target. Let go of the string. Watch the arrow fly!
content.tw: 你會射箭嗎? 很簡單，把箭放在弓弦上，然後拉弓。你希望弓箭往哪裡射呢? 瞄準你的目標，然後放箭。

content.en: Shooting a bow for sport is fun! But do we need arms to do it?
content.tw: 射箭運動很好玩! 但我們需要手臂才能射箭嗎?

content.en: Ask Matt Stutzman. He was born with no arms. He shoots a bow.
content.tw: 問問看Matt Stutzman，他天生沒有手臂，但他會射箭。

content.en: How does Matt do this? He holds his bow with his foot. He pulls the string with his chin.
content.tw: 他怎麼做到的呢? 他用腳拿弓，用下巴拉弓。

content.en: Matt can hit any target. He shoots very well. He won a silver medal for the USA at the Paralympics. This big competition is for athletes with disabilities.
content.tw: Matt很會射箭，他代表美國在帕運會拿下銀牌。帕運會是為身障運動員舉辦的比賽。

content.en: Matt wants everyone to know he can do anything. His disability doesn't stop him. Matt wants to win a gold medal at next year's Paralympics.
content.tw: Matt希望每一個人都知道身體的缺陷無法限制他，他可以做任何事。他希望能在明年帕運會上贏得金牌。

content.en: This Sunday is the International Day of Persons with Disabilities. Let's learn about Matt and other people with disabilities. Let's learn what they can do!
content.tw: 這個禮拜天是國際身心障礙者日。我們可以從Matt跟其他的身心障礙者身上學習他們可以做到的事。

content.en: Matt uses what he has... and he hits his target!
content.tw: Matt運用他所擁有的…並且達成了他的目標！

vocabulary.preface: 用腳也可以射箭，真是了不起的本領!

content.text: 1. shoot 射擊 Check this out, Nancy. 你看，南西。 I'm going to shoot the bullseye this time. 我這次要射中紅心。 Sure, just like last time when you hit the teacher's hat. 當然，就跟你上次射中老師的帽子一樣。
2. point 指著 I wasn't pointing at her hat! 我並沒有瞄準她的帽子! Oh no, I can't believe I missed it! 我不敢相信我沒射中!
3. target 箭靶 You still hit the target. 你還是射中箭靶啦。 But not the center. 但是不是中心。
4. let go of 放手 I think I let go of the arrow too late. 我覺得我放箭的時間太晚了。 No worries. You'll get better. 別擔心，你會進步的。 Now let me give it a try.現在讓我來試試。

vocabulary.postscript: 你有看過奧運的射箭比賽嗎? shoot射擊 point指出 target箭靶 let go of放手

title: The Beatles Make One More Song

content.en: Who are the Beatles? They're a band from the UK. Many people think the Beatles are the best band in the world!
content.tw: 你知道披頭四嗎? 那是一個英國樂團。很多人覺得披頭四是世界上最棒的樂團。

content.en: The Beatles had four people: John, Paul, George, and Ringo. But they stopped being a band in nineteen seventy. Sadly, John died ten years later…
content.tw: 披頭四有四位成員，約翰、保羅、喬治跟林哥，他們在1970就解散了。十年後約翰不幸地去世。

content.en: But now the Beatles have a new song. What? How can they have a new song? Well, John wrote a song many years ago. It's called "Now and Then". He recorded it on a cassette tape.
content.tw: 但現在披頭四要發行一首新歌 「這時候那時候」。他們怎麼會有新歌呢? 原來約翰很多年前寫了這首歌，並且錄在卡帶上。

content.en: But the recording was very bad. John's voice was hard to hear.
content.tw: 但是錄音品質很糟糕，聽不清楚約翰的聲音。

content.en: After John died, Paul, George, and Ringo took this old song and made it better. But it needed more work. Then George died…
content.tw: 約翰死後，保羅、喬治跟林哥拿到這首老歌，提升了它的品質，但還需要修改。喬治後來也過世了。

content.en: This year, the Beatles made John's voice easy to hear. How did they do that? They used AI.
content.tw: 今年他們用AI人工智慧，讓約翰的聲音更清楚地呈現。

content.en: All four Beatles worked on this song. Paul and Ringo finished it. "Now and Then" is on the radio a lot now. Many people like the song. Many think "Now and Then" is a sad song. But they also think it's a beautiful song.
content.tw: 披頭四的四位成員都參與了這首歌的製作。保羅和林哥完成了它。「這時候那時候」現在廣泛在電台播放。很多人喜歡這首歌。許多人認為「這時候那時候」是一首悲傷的歌。但他們也認為這是一首美麗的歌。

vocabulary.preface: 所有披頭四的成員先後都參與了這首歌的製作，人工智慧也幫了忙。

content.text: 1. best 最好的 July Sky is coming to town! 七月的天空要來這兒! July Sky? What's that? 七月的天空? 那是什麼? You've never heard of them? 你沒聽過他們嗎? I think they're the best band in Taiwan. 我認為他們是台灣最好的樂團。
2. how 如何 How do you know they're coming? 你怎麼知道他們要來? My friend told me. 我朋友告訴我的。 He works in a record company.他在一家唱片公司工作。
3. hard 困難的 Can he get tickets for you? 他可以幫你弄到票嗎? He said it'll be hard. 他說有困難。 Do you want to go to their show? 你想去看他們表演?
4. song 歌曲 Sure, I'd like to hear their songs. 當然，我想去聽他們的歌。 You like joining in on the fun, don't you? 你滿喜歡湊熱鬧的嘛。

vocabulary.postscript: 來跟我一起讀單字。 best最好的 how如何 hard困難的 song歌曲

title: Man Will Ride Bike Across the South Pole

content.en: Man Will Ride Bike Across the South Pole What is the loneliest place in the world? It's somewhere very few people live. Maybe it’s Antarctica! That’s the cold, snowy place around the South Pole.
content.tw: 這世界上最寂寞的地方在哪裡呢? 應該是南極洲，那裡很冷、而且滿地都是雪。

content.en: Omar Di Felice wants to ride his bike all the way across Antarctica. He tried to do this last year. But he stopped after one week. He felt too lonely. His family needed him too.
content.tw: Omar Di Felice 想騎著單車跨越南極洲。他去年試過一次，但一個星期後就放棄了。他當時覺得太孤單寂寞，他的家人也需要他。

content.en: Now Omar wants to try again. He will start at one side. He will cross the South Pole. Then he will finish at the other side. He will ride two thousand kilometers!
content.tw: Omar 現在想再試一次。他要從南極洲的一端騎車2000公里到另一邊。

content.en: Omar has a special bike. It's called a fatbike. It has wide tires. Omar can ride on snow and ice with this bike. He can carry his tent, clothes, and food on this bike.
content.tw: Omar有一個特別的單車，叫做粗輪自行車。這種腳踏車有很寬的輪胎，可以騎在冰雪地面，也可以搭載帳篷、衣服跟食物。

content.en: Riding a bike across Antarctica will not be easy. It will be very cold and very windy. The bike will be heavy. But Omar wants to do this.
content.tw: 騎單車橫越南極洲可不容易，又冷又颳著風。單車也很笨重，但是Omar還是要這麼做。

content.en: Omar will be the first to ride a bike all the way across Antarctica. He knows he will be lonely. But this time, he’s ready!
content.tw: Omar 將會是第一個騎單車橫越南極洲的人。他知道自己會很孤單，但這次他準備好了！

vocabulary.preface: 在南極洲騎單車雖然困難重重，Omar仍然決定再接再厲。

content.text:
1. snowy 下雪的
It snowed on Datunshan last night! 昨天晚上大屯山下雪了!
Oh my God! We must go up there! 天哪，我們一定得趕去!
Now? It could still be snowy and cold. 現在? 可能還在下雪，並且很冷。

2. ride 騎
No worries. 不擔心。
See the sun? The snow has stopped. 看到太陽了嗎? 雪已經停了。
We can even ride my motorbike up there. 我們甚至可以騎摩托車上去。

3. across 橫越
It’ll be faster than driving a car. 會比開車快。
You can count me out. 別把我算進去了。
I don’t want to ride a motorbike across the mountain.我可不想騎摩托車橫越山區。

4. lonely 寂寞孤單的
Come on, Jane! 好啦，珍!
I would feel too lonely without you. 沒有你我會覺得很寂寞。
